Astronomy is the study of celestial objects and phenomena. It includes the sun, moon, stars, galaxies, and planets. People who study astronomy are called astronomers. They use telescopes to see far away objects. They also use math to understand how these objects move and change. Astronomy helps us understand our place in the universe. It also helps us make maps of the sky and predict events like eclipses.
